intro: Pedicularis magnini, commonly known as the yellow monkeyflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant produces striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, adapting to its alpine environment. Pedicularis magnini is often found in rocky soils and is a popular choice for rock gardens due to its ornamental value.
